title: [GAMEPLAY] QSS removed Baron buff
body: Our team got Baron buff and we did teamfight. (I DID have it and i DID NOT die) Was playing as Zed and after using ult i used Quicksilver Sash to get out of CC and after it i didn't have baron buff anymore, whilst all of my teammates still had it. (It did not run out)

replies.body: Can't reproduce with QSS and it's upgrade. Have you gotten this to trigger under a control environment?

Would you be able to check the scrpits that control morde's ghosts. Particularity the targeting. When you have a ranged ghost when you click on the inhibitors, and turrets, unless you click really close to the exact center the ghost thinks you want them to walk over there, and then they pick up their auto targeting system, and start attacking. Inhibitors are particularly nasty to aim at with a ranged ghost (especially non-dragon ghosts).

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Exgeniar,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=HGq8K020,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-03-22T22:33:49.640+0000)
>
> Can't reproduce with QSS and it's upgrade. Have you gotten this to trigger under a control environment?

It was probably a 1/10000000 chance spaghetti code interaction that probably had something to do with the specific CC he was under so it might help to know what CC he was QSS'ing out of. That being said, I have lost Baron buff to Death's dance bleed damage because the game said for a split second 'you're dead' and stripped the buff, then realized 'But hey you're not dead, but bleeding out' but never returned the buff.

Attempt to recreate this under the CC of A) Leona, B) Irelia, C) Cho'Gath, or D) Hecarim. 

The only time that Amordis would've had baron buff was the ~40 minute mark, according to recent match history. QSS was upgraded, the enemy team appeared to be Leona, Ezreal, Hecarim, Irelia, and Cho'gath. 

Possibly one of these crowd controls may have had an odd interaction with the champion's code and the quicksilver sash's cleanse.
If I had to guess I'd say it involved either guardian angel, hexdrinker/maw of maltorius, or death's dance and actually had nothing to do with QSS.
That'll teach you to play Zed.
Says the guy with the Project: Zed icon.
